segments.script:
The women of New Vegas ask me a lot if there's a Mrs. New Vegas. Well, of course there is. You're her. And I'm always diggin' up the latest scoop for you, sweetie.

I heard from someone who knows someone in the NCR that the whole Ranger Unification thing between Nevada and California isn't all sunshine and rainbows. Apparently, the Desert Rangers are gettin' a mite restless about bein' under NCR command out here in the Mojave Wasteland. Word is they're itching to break free and go back to their old ways.

Now, unquote that if you will - I'm just reportin' what I heard. But it does make for some interesting speculate, don't you think? The Desert Rangers turnin' rogue could stir up quite the ruckus in these parts. Guess we'll just have to keep our ears to the ground and wait and see.

That's all for now, darlin'. Keep on lovin' life in the Mojave! This is Mr. New Vegas, your favorite radio host with a heart of gold and the voice of smooth velvet. Stay fabulous, out there!

segments.script:
This is Mr. New Vegas, and I feel something magic in the air tonight. 

I heard from a reliable source - her name's Veronica, lovely lass with a heart of gold - that rumors are swirling around the Mojave Outpost like tumbleweeds in a sandstorm. Someone told me that a group of rebels is planning to blow up the Unification Monument! Can you dig it? Blowing up history, right under our noses. I mean, quote/unquote 'reclaiming the wasteland from oppressive forces', unquote.

Now, word is these rebels have got some serious tech backing them up. But I've got my doubts. Sounds like a wild story to me, Mrs. New Vegas. I'm sure it's just desert fever talk. Still, always good to keep an ear out for such things. We wouldn't want our beloved monument to go boom now, would we? Keep those ears open and your hearts full of love, darlings! This is Mr. New Vegas, signing off.

segments.script:
"Well hello there, sweetheart! It's your main man Mr. New Vegas here on Radio Appalachia, spinning you a tale of wasteland whispers. I heard from a friend of a friend that the folks in the NCR are getting mighty nervous about those Caesar's Legion scum. Word is they're regrouping somewhere out east, maybe even planning another march on the Capitol. Now, I don't know if there's any truth to that rumor, but it does have some cats talking.

Someone told me they spotted a whole bunch of Legionaires heading east from the Colorado River recently. Of course, that doesn't necessarily mean they're after the NCR capital - could just be business as usual for those nasty raiders. Still, I thought you might dig hearing about it, Mrs. New Vegas. Keep your ears to the ground and your rifle handy, 'kay? Now, let's get back to some smooth tunes to soothe your savage soul."
